name: 2,2-Dimethyl-5-[(5-phenyl-2-furyl)methylene]-1,3-dioxane-4,6-dione
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-3893
Reason: The melting point of this compound can be predicted by considering the structural features of the molecule. The furyl group (C6H4) and the phenyl group (C6H5) both contribute to the melting point due to their potential for forming hydrogen bonds. The methylene group (CH2) can also contribute to the melting point due to its ability to form hydrogen bonds. The dioxane ring system can also contribute to the melting point due to its rigidity and potential for forming hydrogen bonds. The presence of multiple functional groups in the molecule can also increase the melting point due to the increased intermolecular forces present.
